Ajax Engineering IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and latest GMPAjax Engineering IPO allotment status: The IPO price band was set at Rs 599 to Rs 629 per share. The minimum lot size for the application was 23 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required was Rs 13,777.

Can a married couple save more taxes using both old and new tax regime?Married couples need to determine which tax regime offers lower tax liability for each spouse considering their income structure and deductions.

India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in January, hits a five-month lowThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices, according to data released by the National Statistics Office on Wednesday.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

Sensex tumbles over 850 points as US tariff fears spook Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex nosedived 834.39 points to 75,459.21 at 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 251.95  points to trade at 22,819.85.

Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

entertainment.headline: Olivia Swann on NCIS: Sydney, her character's growth & challenges In this exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Olivia Swann dives deep into her role in NCIS: Sydney, sharing insights into her character's journey, development, and challenges throughout the series.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

Too much to handle: Samay Raina deletes all videos from his show amid jokes rowComedian Samay Raina finally broke his silence on the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's remark on his show, India's Got Latent. He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

Kanye West dropped by talent agency amid antisemitic, controversial actionsKanye West's controversial actions have led to his talent agency, 33&West, dropping him. The decision follows a series of antisemitic remarks and troubling social media posts by the rapper that have sparked widespread condemnation.

Samay Raina's show in Gujarat cancelled amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina's Gujarat shows have been cancelled following a controversy sparked by the latest episode of his show, India's Got Latent. The decision comes amid backlash after a distasteful comment by YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia on the show.

Indian Army says ceasefire along LoC intact, denies reports of heavy firingThe Indian Army denied reports of heavy firing along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir and said the ceasefire is intact.

No black warrants in 5 years. Is India skipping the noose?No capital punishment has been approved by the Supreme Court for a second year in a row in India. The last hangings in India were in 2020, when the Nirbhaya case convicts were executed. Though India hasn't officially scrapped capital punishment, despite repeated calls from several quarters, the Supreme Court, it seems, is exercising the utmost restraint when it comes to sending convicts to the gallows.

Telangana to hold another round of caste survey for those left out after backlashTelangana has announced a second phase of its caste survey from February 16 to 28 to cover the 3.1 per cent population left out earlier. The move follows criticism from BRS and backward classes groups over alleged undercounting.

PM Modi arrives in Washington DC, to hold bilateral meet with Donald Trump Live UpdatesPM Modi will be the fourth world leader, after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Japan's Shigeru Ishiba and Jordan's king Abdullah II, to meet Trump in his second presidential term.

Alien planet that can fit 263 Earths inside it discovered from IndiaThe planet, dubbed TOI-6038A b, is a dense sub-Saturn size with a mass of 78.5 Earth masses and a radius of 6.41 Earth radii in a wide binary system.

Watch: England's snoozefest in Ahmedabad puts Jofra Archer to sleep in dugoutIndia vs England: England fast bowler Jofra Archer fell asleep in the dugout during England's batting in the 3rd ODI match on Wednesday. England failed to turn up with the bat and lost the game by 142 runs.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
